item.description: <p>In a brief, unsigned order, the conservative-majority court said the policy isn&#x27;t discriminatory. </p>

item.title: Some common medications linked to adverse breast cancer outcomes, study claims
item.description: <p>M﻿illions of Australians take pills to manage common conditions, but researchers have sounded a warning.</p>

item.title: Louvre CCTV system 'had laughable password' leading up to heist
item.description: <p>Security at t﻿he world famous museum has come under scathing criticism by a panel of experts.</p>

item.title: 'The right time': Livinia Nixon signs off from 9News weather after 21 years
item.description: <p>Nine&#x27;s much-loved Melbourne weather presenter Livinia Nixon will step away from her role this month after more than two decades.</p>

item.title: Cop who was hailed a 'hero' on social media jailed over $100,000 robbery from sex offender's home
item.description: <p>The NSW officer, whose identity is protected by court orders, knew his 78-year-old victim had a stash of cash in a safe.</p>

item.title: Rachael spent 100 hours on this painting. Someone took it in just minutes in a suspected case of mistaken stre
item.description: <p>Rachael Egan was in the process of moving home when the centrepiece of her exhibition disappeared from the footpath.</p>

item.title: Bruce Lehrmann at risk of arrest without medical certificate, court hears
item.description: <p>Bruce Lehrmann is at risk of arrest after failing to submit a medical certificate explaining his absence from court on car theft charges.</p>

item.title: GTA VI delayed again as fans forced to wait even longer for most anticipated game ever
item.description: <p>The release date of <em>Grand Theft Auto VI </em>has been pushed back once again, forcing fans to wait even longer to get their hands on arguably the hotly anticipated title.</p>

item.title: Today, this city felt 25 degrees. Tomorrow, it'll feel like 5
item.description: <p>One Australian city enjoying the sun today will feel temperatures dramatically plummet by up to 20 degrees tomorrow.﻿</p>

item.title: BBC newsreader who corrected 'pregnant people' to 'women' during live broadcast broke impartiality rules
item.description: <p>During a broadcast she overruled her autocue that said &quot;pregnant people&quot; as she introduced a guest.</p>

item.title: Typhoon Kalmaegi hammers central Vietnam after battering the Philippines
item.description: <p>Typhoon Kalmaegi brought fierce winds and torrential rains to Vietnam on Friday, days after the powerful storm battered the Philippines and left scores dead or missing.</p>

item.title: Former Neighbours star Damien Richardson found guilty over Nazi gesture
item.description: <p>A magistrate has heard two days of evidence and honed in on what the actor said immediately after his controversial act.</p>

item.title: Melbourne man Athan Boursinos's killers travelled from NSW for hit, police say
item.description: <p>P﻿olice have released new CCTV footage after Athan Boursinos was shot dead outside his home in July.</p>

item.title: 'Worst I've ever seen': Pressure mounts on Sussan Ley after senior Liberal's scathing broadside
item.description: <p>The opposition leader is facing even more pressure after a rare public rebuke from one of her own senators.</p>

item.title: Thousands of flights to be cut across US amid government shutdown
item.description: <p>A﻿irports to be impacted include popular gateways for Aussies travelling to North America.</p>

item.title: Aussie teacher stood down over controversial Charlie Kirk Halloween costume
item.description: <p>A senior teacher from South Australia has been stood down and is under investigation for wearing a Charlie Kirk costume to school for Halloween last week. </p>

item.title: 'Drove him crazy': Man kills scooter rider over affair
item.description: <p>A jealous man killed a former close friend after being driven &quot;crazy&quot; over his girlfriend&#x27;s affair with him.</p>

item.title: Police probe whether protester violence was pre-planned during on-campus meeting
item.description: <p>Police are investigating whether left-wing counter-protesters&#x27; violent actions at a Melbourne rally, where police were pelted by rocks, were pre-planned.</p>

item.title: Adelaide prepares for 93rd annual Christmas Pageant
item.description: <p>Road closures in the central business district are scheduled to commence as early as midnight, with some restrictions remaining in place until 2pm tomorrow.</p>

item.title: Special tribute to young cricketer as teammates prepare to return to competition following tragedy
item.description: <p>A﻿ Melbourne cricket oval has been painted with the initials and cap number of a teenager tragically killed after a training mishap last week, as his teammates prepare to return to the field tomorrow.</p>

item.title: Search for hit-run driver after pair seriously injured crossing the road
item.description: <p>Police have released CCTV vision of a car ﻿travelling near the scene of the crash at the time in the hopes the public can help them identify the driver.</p>

item.title: Dad pens tribute to young children killed in Queensland house fire
item.description: <p>The father of two children killed in a house fire in central Queensland yesterday has paid tribute to his ﻿&quot;little princess&quot; and &quot;best little mate&quot; as police investigate the cause of the blaze.</p>

item.title: Three tradies fight for life after being hit by car outside restaurant in Sydney's west
item.description: <p>The three men were standing outside a business when a car mounted the curb.</p>

item.title: Man arrested after girl, 10, and woman killed in car crash in outback Queensland community
item.description: <p>A car carrying five people ﻿crashed in Doomadgee.</p>

item.title: Property search for SA woman missing for almost 40 years ends
item.description: <p>P﻿olice searched a property near Mount Gambier for the remains of missing woman Margaret Bernie.</p>

item.title: High-rise towers and retail space planned for Gold Coast shopping centre redevelopment
item.description: <p>A significant redevelopment proposal has been lodged for a Gold Coast shopping centre, potentially transforming the ageing site into a mixed-use precinct featuring three residential towers and a revitalised retail space. </p>

item.title: Former NAB employee charged over alleged role in one of the largest fraud schemes in Australian history
item.description: <p>Timotius Donny Sungkar was arrested today by the Financial Crimes Squad after being accused of stealing millions.</p>

item.title: Pair on the run after Gold Coast teen stabbed centimetres from his heart over 'debt'
item.description: <p>Two male offenders remain on the run following a stabbing on ﻿Batchworth Road, Molendinar, about 7.30pm where they came to a house and asked for the 17-year-old Carrara boy by name.</p>

item.title: Prison nurse apologises to family over inmate's death
item.description: <p>Hunt became combative after the seizure and struggled against prison guards who roughly handled him, pinning him down on a mattress, handcuffing him and putting him in a spit hood.</p>

item.title: Inmate mistakenly released from London prison arrested after more than a week of freedom
item.description: <p>A convicted sex offender who was mistakenly released early from a London prison was arrested after more than a week of freedom, police said.</p>
